dialogues.TONY:
[1]My God! That's it! You're right! Anthony Shepherd! They call me Tony. Tony Shepherd! That's who I am! 
[2]Yes...That's right! That's right! But how?... 
[3]But that's amazing! Brilliant! Was there anything else? 
[4]That's absolutely fantastic! Thank you. Perhaps I'll remember other things.

[6]What's that?

[29]Oh, hello, good morning sir. How are you feeling? That was a nasty bump on the head you got.. 
[30]Well, sir, I've been thinking... It's clear the show's not attracting many people. Forgive me but... I see two ways of tackling this problem. 
[31]Either the style of the show is at fault... or the type of audience. I would suggest changing both. 
[32]I'm sorry but.. you're not modern. People want modern. Look. 
[33]This is modern. It works. Trust me, I understand this world. This kind of mind control. Let's try to meet the public halfway.. the right public.. and in a better part of town. 
[34]What? 
[35]There'll be a better class of police too. 
[36]The trick is not to hide. Change your colours. Be bold. Go where they would least expect to find you. I think we have been brought together for a reason. I don't believe in coincidence. You saved my life. Now let me do something in return. 
[37]This can be my birthday gift to Valentina. 
[38]Well... First of all, I want you to give me your money. All of it. 
[39]Excuse me, madam. I'm afraid we can't accept this. 
[40]We are here to give...not take. We are here to help those in need. If it's money you need, then here it is. If it's the flowering of the soul you need, then here we are but, unfortunately we are booked solid at the moment. But thank you.. I can see you have a generous spirit. 
[41]Cost? Money is no good in the Imaginarium.   This is a refuge for hearts in need of truth. A place for souls to be purified. 
[42]Madam, why should you care about time? What are your dreams worth in minutes? 
[43]There are hard choices to be made in life. What about the dreams of the less fortunate in the world. Do you have time for their dreams? Or are you like I once was...do you just despair? Despair at all that is wrong in the world.. ...despair at your inability to do anything to change it.. to make it better...I despaired so much at the powerlessness of my own existence that I took the easy way out...the coward's way...I committed suicide! Yes, that's right, I killed myself. Can you understand my despair? But I was saved...saved by a miracle...The Imaginarium...and Doctor Parnassus. He brought me back from the dead. He gave me a new life. A reason to live. He has given me power to dream again... to dream of a better world. 
[44]Please, I'm sorry but, we're booked solid at the moment. 
[45]Madam, congratulations, you have been chosen. 
[46]Come forward and enter the Imaginarium. 
[47]We don't want your money. We want your hopes and dreams. You may make a donation later, if you wish. 
[48]This is a rare moment. Very few are chosen. Don't miss this once-in-a- life-time opportunity. This way. Please. 
[49]Believe me Madam, you're the luckiest woman in the world. 
[50]Tony... 
[51]If I'm not wrong, I fear you must go alone. 
[52]It's one of the rules... One imagination at a time, free from the influence of another. 
[53]Oh..look... another possibility.. 
[54]You must make a choice...and... actually, to be honest, I'd strongly recommend this one. 
[55]Exactly. To be reborn, first you must die. All of them have achieved a kind of immortality. And we love them all the more for it. They won't get old or fat. They won't get sick or feeble. They are beyond fear. They are forever young. They are gods. And you can join them. 
[56]There's not a moment to lose. 
[57]But your sacrifice must be pure. You have to let go of all these worldly goods. 
[58]Remember nothing is permanent... not even death.

[60]..how do you do this?

[70]Yes, I know, and you're right, but that's the way the grown-up..the real world works. You can't make omelettes without soiling your hands. Or should that be the other way round? Anyway, I - with hindsight very foolishly - accepted a loan from people who seemed to me, at the time, to be very decent and sincere. And I have to live with that. I'm sorry. What more can I say?
